<<<code>>>:
```java
ByteArrayOutputStream baos = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
DataOutputStream dos = new DataOutputStream(baos);

dos.writeInt(123); // Write an int
dos.write(new byte[]{1, 2, 3}); // Write a byte array

byte[] output = baos.toByteArray(); // Get the byte array
```

Finally, we get the byte array that represents the output by calling the ByteArrayOutputStream's toByteArray() method.

Note: The ByteArrayOutputStream's toByteArray() method returns a copy of the byte array, so any changes to the byte array returned by this method will not affect the original ByteArrayOutputStream.

Also note: The DataOutputStream's write() method can take a byte array or a String, so you can also write a String to the DataOutputStream by calling dos.writeUTF("Hello, world!").
